article_title: Congress undermines public trust by overriding mammography guidelines, authors say

article_metadata.description: Last December, Congress slipped into its $1.15 trillion spending bill a measure that “undermines women’s rights to make informed decisions based on the best scientific evidence,” according to a commentary published recently in the Journal of the American Medical Association (JAMA).

og.description: In December, Congress required health insurers to follow breast cancer screening guidelines from 2002 rather than two more recent ones.
og.title: Congress undermines public trust by overriding mammography guidelines, authors say
